data.title: Pelosi defends stock trading while amassing $263 million net worth
data.description: In 2021, Nancy Pelosi was asked if Congress should be banned from trading stocks. Her Response: "No… This is a free market." While serving 37 years in Congress with an annual salary of $223,500, she increased her net worth to an estimated $263,000,000.

data.title: Jensen Huang’s Vision: Nvidia’s AI-Powered Computing Future
data.description:
Nvidia Corp (NVDA:US) CEO Jensen Huang envisions a future where the company operates with 50,000 employees and 100 million AI assistants. These AI agents will handle tasks across departments, from cybersecurity to software development, working alongside human employees to enhance productivity. Huang believes AI will complement, not replace, jobs, enabling Nvidia to grow while securing employment.

Huang also argues that Moore’s Law has ended, marking the rise of GPUs over traditional CPUs. He predicts that GPU technology will replace the $1 trillion CPU-based data center market, as Nvidia’s full-stack solutions offer more efficiency. Additionally, Huang foresees AI integration across all business applications, revolutionizing tools like Word, Excel, and Photoshop with embedded AI assistants.

Nvidia’s dominance in AI is underpinned by its comprehensive hardware-software approach, positioning it at the forefront of the AI revolution. Competitors may emerge, but Huang remains confident that Nvidia's innovation will keep it ahead.

As Nvidia shapes the future, it has drawn significant interest in the stock market, with several politicians buying shares. Notable figures like Rep. Pete Sessions, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, and Rep. Nancy Pelosi have recently purchased Nvidia stock, underscoring the company’s role in driving AI’s expansion across industries.

data.title: Nvidia Faces Near $300B Loss & Causes Ripple Effect on Stocks
data.description:
On Wednesday, global semiconductor and related stocks declined sharply after Nvidia’s significant drop in share price in the U.S. market overnight.

Once one of the biggest headliners of AI stocks, NVIDIA Corp (NVDA:US) saw a perplexing stock price decline of 17.08% in the past five days. During market hours on September 3, 2024, NVDA stock saw a price drop of 9%, leading to a broader sell-off among semiconductor stocks on Wall Street. 

Nvidia’s supply chain connections extend to South Korea, affecting companies like memory chip maker SK Hynix and conglomerate Samsung Electronics. Samsung’s shares fell 3.45%, while SK Hynix, which supplies high bandwidth memory chips to Nvidia, saw an 8% drop. In Japan, Tokyo Electron Ltd (TOELY:US) fell 8.5%, and Advantest Corp (ATEYY:US), a semiconductor testing equipment supplier, dropped nearly 8%. SoftBank Group (SFTBY:US), a major shareholder in chip designer Arm, declined 7.7%.

What drove NVDA’s price further down in after-market hours was an announcement that the company had received a subpoena from the Department of Justice. In contrast, a representative from the company told CNBC that they had not received such a notice.

The decline seems to have raised questions about the future profitability of the AI sector, not just Asian stocks. 

For the past several quarters, Nvidia has only posted strong earnings results. The company’s last reported earnings - the second quarter of fiscal 2025 - disclosed a record quarterly revenue of $30.0 billion, a 15% increase from the previous quarter and a 122% increase compared to the same period last year. Although still high, it failed to meet analyst’s expectations. According to a Chief Market Strategist at the Carson Group: ‘The bar was just set a tad too high this earnings season.’ 

In addition, the company’s board approved an additional $50.0 billion for share buybacks, with no expiration date. Before this, the company disclosed a quarterly revenue of $26.0 billion in Q1 Fiscal 2025; this was 262% higher year-on-year. 

Despite the price decline, NVDA shares are trading at nearly 120.5% higher year-to-date. A member of the US stock market’s ‘Magnificent 7’, Nvidia is one of the most traded stocks by Congress members, with more than 200 trades in the past three years. Previously, Rep. John James, Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, and Rep. Jared Moskowitz were the latest politicians to report their NVDA purchases while Rep. Kathy Manning’s spouse sold as much as $80,000 worth of Nvidia stock on July 2. 

Arguably, the most famous case of a Politician trading NVDA was by former House speaker Nancy Pelosi. Her husband, Paul Pelosi, has purchased up to $5 million worth of NVDA in two transactions; one on June 26 and the other exactly a month later.

data.title: A Market-Defining Moment Approaches with NVDA's Upcoming Earnings
data.description:
Earnings season is in full swing, and the financial markets are buzzing with anticipation. When Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell announced the decision to start cutting interest rates, it was a momentous occasion that resonated across the U.S. markets. With S&P, Nasdaq, and Russel all leading index jumping substantially.

However, the market's recent recovery from August's lows, triggered by carry trades and a surprise rate increase by the Japanese Central Bank, faces a key test with the upcoming earnings report from AI leader Nvidia Corp (NVDA:US), scheduled for release after the bell on Wednesday, August 28. Investors are keenly watching for updates on sustained data center growth and any developments regarding potential delays in the new Blackwell artificial intelligence (AI) chip.

Nvidia's stock has experienced a significant rebound in August, rising nearly 25%, despite a steep sell-off earlier in the year that saw its value drop by about 23%. This recovery has brought relief to investors, but concerns remain about the company's financial outlook. 

In the first quarter of fiscal 2025, Nvidia projected Q2 revenue of approximately $28 billion, plus or minus 2%. While many analysts anticipate that the company might exceed these expectations, a sharp decline in earnings per share (EPS) is likely expected, due to the recent 10-for-1 stock split, even though the latest reported EPS was quite minute.

On the competitive front, Advanced Micro Devices Inc (AMD:US)  is making strategic moves to challenge Nvidia, with one such being a $5 billion acquisition of cloud computing solutions firm ZT Systems. AMD aims to enhance its existing silicon and software capabilities and accelerate the deployment of large-scale AI infrastructure through this acquisition.

Meanwhile, in the realm of congressional trading, Nvidia has attracted significant interest from investors on Capitol Hill. Congressional trades involving Nvidia have totaled approximately $7.73 million this year, spanning 40 transactions. 

While 25 of these were divestments totaling $1.53 million, the 15 buy trades totaled $6.20 million. One of the most successful trading politicians, former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband made a significant investment earlier this year, acquiring 10,000 shares at $113.06 each, amounting to $1.13 million.

The upcoming earnings report by Nvidia is of critical importance, and if recent investments by noteworthy figures like Nancy Pelosi’s husband are any indication, the stock is positioned to maintain its upward momentum.
